conclusion: Analyze the path and potential interactions with blocks to determine collisions and stop position.
Car is positioned on the right side of the image moving towards the left; blocks are scattered on the green surface.
Car will first encounter the blue block near the center of the image.
Collision with the blue block will deflect the car; direction and extent depend on angle and speed.
After first collision, car will likely encounter more blocks depending on deflection direction and force.
Deflection is more significant if block is larger or car is moving at higher speed.
Car continues to move until it stops or collides with another block.
Car stops when it no longer has enough momentum to overcome friction and collision forces.
Exact stop location depends on collision sequence and resulting deflections.
Car is moving from right to left, first colliding with the blue block.
After first collision, deflection determines next block collision.
Car continues to move and collide until it stops.
Car will collide with the blue block first.
After first collision, car will be deflected and continue moving, potentially colliding with other blocks.
Exact stop location depends on collision sequence and deflections.
Initial collision is with the blue block.
